page.title: 10Farming in Malhamdale
page.content: There is no arable land.Most farmers raise sheep (mainly Swaledale) or cattle (mainly Friesian).The sheep's fleeces are sent to Bradford and the cows' milk to Leeds from the individual farms.With the abundance of high land,the main stock reared is sheep.The lambs are born around March,and the older sheep are sheared in June.Siloing gets underway on the lower pastures in June/July,giving way to haymaking in July/August.However,these are very dependent upon the weather. Much of the farmland is moorland and this tends to be spread about,not necessarily clustered around the farmhouse.
